message: > weird I just got your "it does" message, but it days "4 minutes ago"
Sometimes I don't get a message from somebody until I post myself...
there have been more and more problems with this lately
could it have anything to do with sizes of topics? It seems possible

sometimes I write a few messages and try to switch topics and get a warning "you still have outgoing messages being processed". usually waiting doesn't help, it will be stuck like that for minutes sometimes and the messages will never be posted
could it have anything to do with sizes of topics? It seems possible
I'm having most problems in a topic with over 25k messages
btw I did *not* double post the message an hour ago
actually we started a new chat and again there were problems, so it can't have anythign to do with the number of messages
This should probably be turned into a new feature: mark messages as unsent somehow, e.g. with a spinny icon or a different color.
@jjthrash there is a feature like this, an unsent message has a green box around it and if you try to leave the page it warns you
and I keep using it. I think I'll probably still be on here when it gets consistently fast again
twitter is often slow as molasses too

@bat twitter's usually had a fast api that kinda helped them, if the site was slow you could just switch to a program and if the api was lagging you just switch to the site, convore has neither, there site is so slow and there api is even slower, 3mins for an api response how is a developer suppose to write cool things, i have a pretty nice idea and it is taking forever to do because the api lags and i can't tell if it is a json parse error or the api timed out so yea this isn't good and twitter was in the same boat but they always had a fast outlet if something was slow
